title: 113_s2584
content: The Act is titled the "Educating Tomorrow's Workforce Act of 2014" and includes definitions. The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to include a definition for "career and technical education program of study" as a coordinated sequence of academic and technical courses that meet college and career readiness standards. The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to include standards for career and technical education programs of study that support employability skills, progress in content specificity, incorporate multiple entry and exit points, and culminate in industry-recognized certifications. The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to include standards for career and technical education programs of study that support employability skills, progress in content specificity, incorporate multiple entry and exit points, and culminate in industry-recognized certifications. The term 'credit-transfer agreement' is defined as an opportunity for secondary students to receive postsecondary credit through a formal agreement between secondary and postsecondary education systems for technical credit such as dual enrollment, dual credit, or articulated credit. The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to include standards for career and technical education programs of study that support employability skills and culminate in industry-recognized certifications. The term 'credit-transfer agreement' allows secondary students to receive postsecondary credit through formal agreements for technical credit like dual enrollment or articulated credit. The term 'registered apprenticeship program' refers to an apprenticeship program registered under the National Apprenticeship Act. The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to include standards for career and technical education programs of study culminating in industry-recognized certifications. The state plan section is revised to ensure the quality of programs leading to certificates, credentials, or licenses. Section 124 of the Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to include support for career academies that implement a college and career ready curriculum integrating academic and technical education at the secondary level. The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 supports career academies that offer rigorous academic, technical, and employability content through programs of study. This includes experiential learning with local employers, opportunities for students to earn postsecondary credit, and partnerships between educational agencies, businesses, and higher education institutions. The Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 supports career academies that offer academic, technical, and employability content through programs of study, including partnerships with local employers and postsecondary institutions. Higher education and local government entities may also be involved in these programs. SEC. 5. LOCAL PLAN FOR CAREER AND TECHNICAL EDUCATION PROGRAMS. Section 134(b) of the Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 is amended to include conducting an assessment of local needs related to career and technical education as part of the local plan development process and updating it annually. This assessment should evaluate progress towards high-quality implementation of education programs of study. Professional development for educators, curriculum alignment, and teaching strategies focused on integrating academic and career/technical education. Utilization of labor market information for program decisions and student guidance. The curr_chunk discusses the integration of academic and career/technical education content, ongoing relationships with business and industry, opportunities for students to earn postsecondary credit, career and technical student organizations, equipment aligned with industry needs, and work-based learning. The curr_chunk highlights work-based learning opportunities such as job shadowing, internships, and apprenticeships, technical skills assessments, support services for all students, and recruitment efforts for effective educators. The curr_chunk focuses on local uses of funds. The curr_chunk amends Section 135 of the Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 by updating the language regarding education programs of study and career and technical education programs of study. The curr_chunk adds support for career academies under Section 135 of the Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006. The curr_chunk amends Section 113 of the Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 by updating references to specific sections within the Act.
